model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain relevant and time-sensitive information, enabling the Speaker A to respond appropriately in the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT while accounting for how previous interactions may influence the present moment.

NOTE:
PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is to be regarded as an unhelpful memory.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Speaker A has a pet parrot named Tasha and works as a personal trainer leading hikes.
Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks.
Speaker A enjoys camping trips and looking for wild animals in the woods.
Speaker A is comfortable around animals in the woods but admits a bear would make them jumpy.
Speaker A enjoys hiking, birdwatching, and spotting rare animals.

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
Speaker B: Have you been hiking lately?
Speaker A: Yes I did actually. I lead some friends on a hike in a local trail last weekend. They got tired really quickly as they never go hiking they told me.
Speaker B: Sounds like me. I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway?
Speaker A: Oh they did. We had some nice snacks along the way. Oddly enough, we had some trail mix that someone had made at home. It was quite tasty. We also had some juice and water packed to make sure everyone stayed hydrated. You should join us one day! I'll make it as fun as possible.
Speaker B: I will someday. just not in the summer when all the bugs are out! Where do you go hiking the most?
Speaker A: I like to go hiking in the local trails here. I am familiar with them and there's so many routes that I can take. Sadly, the bugs are as bad here as they are anywhere else.....
Speaker B: They can't be that bad in the fall right? I hope? Do you camp most every weekend?
Speaker A: A least a couple of times a month. Sometimes, yeah, I go every weekend to relax. Being in nature is so relaxing to me. And nah the bugs aren't too bad in the fall and winter. There's a beautiful river along one trail that I bet you'd love to see. 
Speaker B: That sounds like it would be relaxing. I would probable be okay if we didn't run into any wolves, bears etc. Have you ever came across any predators when you were camping? 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities. Speaker B enjoys taking cruises and is not as into the outdoors as Speaker A. Speaker A enjoys camping trips and looking for wild animals in the woods. Speaker A enjoys hiking, birdwatching, and spotting rare animals. Speaker A has never been on a cruise and may consider trying one in the future. Speaker A and Speaker B both enjoy being outdoors, but Speaker B prefers the fresh air over being in the mud and rain. Speaker B shared tips on repelling mosquitos using sprays with 20% DEET and other active ingredients. Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks. Speaker A is a personal trainer who loves camping in remote areas. Speaker B recently went on a long hike and enjoyed it. Speaker A is nervous about the Appalachian Trail hike, as they don't usually do full day hikes.

MEMORY 2:
1. Speaker A enjoys going on camping trips and hiking trails in parks.
2. Speaker A enjoys camping trips and looking for wild animals in the woods.
3. Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities.
4. Speaker B recently went on a long hike and enjoyed it
5. Speaker A has planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
6. Speaker A is comfortable around animals in the woods but admits a bear would make them jumpy.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: In the current dialogue context, Speaker B asks Speaker A about encountering predators while camping. MEMORY 2 contains relevant information that Speaker A is comfortable around animals but is jumpy around bears, which directly addresses Speaker B's question about predators. This information is time-sensitive and enhances the appropriateness of Speaker A's response in the current dialogue. MEMORY 1, while it does mention being nervous about the Appalachian Trail and other shared interests, doesn't provide as direct and helpful information regarding the context of encountering predators as MEMORY 2 does.

Choice: 2
